question.text: Other drivers may sometimes flash their headlights at you. In which situation are they allowed to do this?

explanation.text: If other drivers flash their headlights this isn’t a signal to show priority. The flashing of headlights has the same meaning as sounding the horn, it’s a warning of their presence.

answer.text: To warn of a radar speed trap ahead
To show that they are giving way to you
To warn you of their presence
To let you know there is a fault with your vehicle
